Sentencas: Lanthanum gallate doped with alkaline rare earths (LSGM) powders were densified using an activated microwave sintering process for developing a dense stable electrolyte layer for applications in intermediate temperature-solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Densification of LSGM electrolytes using activated microwave sintering

Sentencas: Due to heat generation in situ, the process of sintering gets activated with faster kinetics compared to a conventional sintering process.
Titulo: Densification of LSGM electrolytes using activated microwave sintering

Sentencas: The effect of various microwave process parameters on the microstructure and phase formation was studied.
Titulo: Densification of LSGM electrolytes using activated microwave sintering

Sentencas: The sintered pellets were characterized using scanning electron microscopy-energy dispersive analysis (SEM-EDAX), and X-ray diffraction (XRD).
Titulo: Densification of LSGM electrolytes using activated microwave sintering

Sentencas: The density of LSGM pellets microwave sintered at 1350degreesC for 20 min is greater than 95% theoretical density with a fine grained microstructure (similar to2-3 mum) and without the presence of other phase(s).
Titulo: Densification of LSGM electrolytes using activated microwave sintering
